comment: A move that can lead to tactical complications.
Developing and attacking the pawn on e5.
This is known as the Scotch Game.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4
1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4
comment: Better is Qxd4 and the queen would dominate the center. If Black then tries 5... c5, he would have a hole on d5 and a backwards d pawn.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5
1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3
comment: After 6...dxc3 7. Nxc3 White has a lead in development as compensation for his pawn.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7
comment: Black should either take the pawn or develop his knight.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O
comment: If Black plays 7... Qxe4 then 8. Re1 pins and wins the queen.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5
comment: Black should pay more attention to development.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5 8. f4
comment: White is giving up his rook for an attack.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5 8. f4 dxc3+ 9. Kh1 cxb2 10. Bxf7+
comment: If 10... Kxf7 then 11. fxe5+ followed by 12. Bxb2.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5 8. f4 dxc3+ 9. Kh1 cxb2 10. Bxf7+ Kd8 11. fxe5 bxa1=Q 12. Bxg8
comment: If 12... Rxg8 then 13. Qb3 Rf8 (If 13... Re8 14. Bb2 winning the queen.) 14. Rxf8+ Bxf8 15. Qf7 Bc5 16. Bg5+ Be7 17 Qf8#. Alternatively, if Black had played 12... Qxe5 then 13. Rf5 Qxe4 14. Bg5+ Ke8 (Not 14... Be7 15. Rf8#.) 15. Bf7+ Kf8 16. Bg6+ Kg8 17. Rf8+ Bxf8 18. Bxe4.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5 8. f4 dxc3+ 9. Kh1 cxb2 10. Bxf7+ Kd8 11. fxe5 bxa1=Q 12. Bxg8 Be7
1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Nxd4 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Bc4 Bc5 6. c3 Qe7 7. O-O Qe5 8. f4 dxc3+ 9. Kh1 cxb2 10. Bxf7+ Kd8 11. fxe5 bxa1=Q 12. Bxg8 Be7 13. Qb3
comment: Threatening 14. Bb2 trapping the queen. Black should try 13... Qxe5 leading to unclear complications.
